Key Match Events: Omani referee Ahmed Al-Kaf extended the match beyond the six minutes of extra time initially indicated, allowing Bahrain to equalize in the 99th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: The Indonesian Football Association (PSSI) has formally submitted a protest letter to both FIFA and the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) regarding the controversial refereeing in the October 10 World Cup qualifier match between Indonesia and Bahrain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The controversy surrounding the match highlights broader concerns about officiating when Middle Eastern referees oversee matches involving non-Middle Eastern teams.
Others: The Indonesian government, through its Ministry of Foreign Affairs, immediately lodged protests with the Badminton World Federation (BWF) and used diplomatic channels to highlight the issue in the Yonex All England 2021 incident.
